thread.title: 'Dilwale' teaser to be attached to 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo'
thread.title_full: 'Dilwale' teaser to be attached to 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo' - Entertainment

author: The Hitlist Team
title: 'Dilwale' teaser to be attached to 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo'
text:
Shah Rukh Khan is likely to cross swords with Salman Khan at the box office next Eid, but that has not stopped him from attaching the teaser of his pre-Christmas release, 'Dilwale' with his newfound friend's Diwali release, 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo'.
Also read:  SRK wishes good luck to Salman for 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo' 

Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol in 'Dilwale' 
A source says, "The makers of Dilwale were looking for an apt date to unveil the promo and what better time than Diwali? After discussions with the creative team, they felt it would be best to reveal the teaser with Salman's film as it is the next big release. Officials of SRK and Salman's production companies met and took the decision."
Also read:  Salman thanks SRK, Aamir for launching 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' look 

Sonam Kapoor and Salman Khan in 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo' 
The two stars have always been pitted against each other for their on-off friendship. After an alleged tiff in 2008, they were not on talking terms for long. However, they decided to bury the hatchet by hugging it out at an Eid party two years ago. Shah Rukh also visited Salman on the eve of his sister Arpita's wedding last November. Since then, the two have been cordial to each other.
Also read:  SRK, Salman bless Arpita on her sangeet ceremony 
"Now, fans will see an exciting reunion of the stars on screen in a different way. Salman's film is a solo release and a big opening is expected since it is releasing on Diwali. Breaking the promo of another much-awaited film with it is a wise idea," says a trade source.
Gaurav Verma, chief revenue officer, Red Chillies Entertainments (RCE), says, "RCE would like to thank Salman Khan and Rajshri Productions for this wonderful gesture."
Also read... 
Salman Khan, Shah Rukh Khan 'hug' the limelight at Arpita's mehendi
